intro: Senecio cirsioides, commonly known as the curly dock, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its rosette of silver-green, curly leaves. The plant produces small, yellow composite flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in dry, open areas. Senecio cirsioides is a hardy perennial that is sometimes considered a weed due to its aggressive growth habit.
